info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Carbon and Monroe Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pocono Raceway, or 9 miles southwest of Mount Pocono, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Jim Thorpe, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Gilbert, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, Skytop, Tannersville, Mountainhome, Alpine Mountain, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Kresgeville, Sun Valley and Jonas. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 75 and 90. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 289 and 308. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
